title: Serum 208

properties.name: description
properties.value: Serum 208 is a permanent cure for the afflicted villagers of Mort'ton. It is used during or after the Shades of Mort'ton quest to turn Afflicted NPCs back into normal characters so the player can interact with them on a permanent basis. Whether it is during or after the quest, it can be created by using Serum 207 on the sacred flame at the rebuilt temple. Players must have at least 20% sanctity in order to convert Serum 207 into Serum 208. Additionally, Serum 207 will always cost 20% sanctity to convert into Serum 208, regardless the dosage level. So it is recommended to convert Serum 207 with at least 2 doses to permanently cure the necessary NPCs (total of two) without wasting additional sanctity.

SMW Subobject for (1)High Alchemy value: 6Examine: 1 dose permanent serum 208 as described in Herbi Flax's diary.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Serum 208Uses infobox: ItemImage: File:Serum 208 (1).pngWeight: 0.020Value: 11Version anchor: 1 doseRelease date: 18 October 2004Item ID: 3419

Serum 208 is a permanent cure for the afflicted villagers of Mort'ton. It is used during or after the Shades of Mort'ton quest to turn Afflicted NPCs back into normal characters so the player can interact with them on a permanent basis. Whether it is during or after the quest, it can be created by using Serum 207 on the sacred flame at the rebuilt temple. Players must have at least 20% sanctity in order to convert Serum 207 into Serum 208. Additionally, Serum 207 will always cost 20% sanctity to convert into Serum 208, regardless the dosage level. So it is recommended to convert Serum 207 with at least 2 doses to permanently cure the necessary NPCs (total of two) without wasting additional sanctity.

It is suggested it be used on Razmire Keelgan, so he will always be coherent for the player and open his general and builder's stores. When used on an afflicted villager, they will turn into Mort'ton locals and reward the player with items such as Olive oil, Tarromin, and Coins.

Although it is a "permanent" cure, ordinary villagers will always return to their afflicted state. (Razmire and Ulsquire Shauncy are the exceptions - although they may appear to turn back to their afflicted state after some time, they will become cured when talked to.) Therefore, there is no way to permanently "clean up" Mort'ton.

On average, curing Mort'ton villagers returns more Tarromin than what is spent for Serum 208 potions, making this a slow, but steady way of obtaining Tarromin.

Cure rewards[edit | edit source]

Curing the affliction of one of the Mort'ton villagers will cause them to give you one of the following items:

Drop rates estimated based on 8,682 cures from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Serum 208 villager cure is worth 265.38.

Date Changes
15 April 2016
(update)

Half full potions could now be turned into bank placeholders.

7 - 22 August 2006

The item was renamed from "Serum 207(p) (n)" to "Serum 208 (n)".

17 May 2005
(update)

An "Empty" option was added.
